ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Sure. Any student in Chinese literature should read Hongloumeng. And the course is taught in a seminar style, which means the students are also welcome to contribute their thoughts and analysis.

I would recommend the course to a student who loves reading Hongloumeng and discussing Hongloumeng with others. If you don't have the patience to deal with its slow pace and the complicated human relations in this novel, please don't waster your time.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Having been reading for many years, some academic instructions on this are really helpful.

I read Hongloumeng many times before, but through taking this class and discussing the novel with others, I learned how to approach this classical novel from multiple perspectives, especially the anthropological perspective. The methodology of close reading, which was emphasized a lot in this class, will be one of the main methodologies in my dissertation writing.
